intro: Parastemon versteeghii, commonly known as the Versteeg's mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pentagonal flowers with five petals, typically in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland habitats.
